SENT.plain: Peripartum cardiomyopathy is a rare cause of dilated cardiomyopathy in parturients, occurring in approximately one in 1000 deliveries, manifesting during the last few months or the first 5 months of the postpartum period
It can result in severe ventricular dysfunction during late puerperium
The major concern while managing these patients is to optimize fluid administration and avoid myocardial depression, while maintaining stable intraoperative hemodynamics
We present a case series of five parturients that were posted for elective cesarean section and managed successfully by the epidural volume extension technique
